Onboard Quickly

Reading source code to build a mental model is slow and error prone. Use visuals to explain concepts and onboard new teammates quickly.

Stay Synchronized

Miscommunications lead to software bugs. Keep everyone on the same page by drawing your mental model.

Interview Remote Candidates

Describing a system in a text document is difficult. Let candidates express themselves with a tool they can learn in seconds.

Explain Anything.

Stop describing complex systems in long slack threads. Use the right tool to communicate effectively.

See More

Simplicity First.

Only three things to master.

Boxes

Command+click on the canvas to create a new box.

Arrows

Command+click two boxes to draw an arrow between them.

Text

Double click on the canvas to create a text box.

?

When should I use this?

If you're collaborating remotely and find yourself reaching for a whiteboard, this tool is perfect. Common usecases include onboarding a new hire, conducting a remote interview, or giving a brownbag talk.

?

Is this a documentation tool?

You're welcome to save a screenshot, but there are better tools if you're just looking to make a static image to save as canonical documentation.

?

Is this a presentation tool?

It's perfect for an ad-hoc presentation to share knowledge with your team. But if you're preparing a presentation for a large audience, you might want to stick to Powerpoint (unless you're David Beazley) .

?

Are there other features?

We'd love to hear about any features you think are missing at feedback@whiteboard.systems.

Ready to get started?
